intro: Urera mannii, commonly known as the African violet or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Urera mannii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural purposes.
